page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: Only 10% of people in our area live close enough to shops or work to travel on foot. Although many own cars, more than 50% still rely on the public transport system. This system is an integrated one, relying on bus services to the local{Metro {Interchange.} The{Metro,}which opened in 1982, provides a rapid and cheap way of travel by rail to many parts of{Tyne {and Wear.} Difficulty of parking in shopping centres, has resulted in 50% of car owners preferring to use the{Metro. } Another means of travel is by{ {British Rail.}Trains run from{Boldon {Colliery}to{Newcastle and Sunderland. The main roads are the{A1T,}running north/south via the{Tyne Tunnel,}and the{A194}running east/west from{South {Shields to Newcastle. }
